description: Sven Halek discreetly authorizes the BCI’s secret amnesty protocol to autonomously restore privileges to blacklisted citizens, instructing Council communicators to downplay irregularities and prepare neutral messaging.
Residents notice dozens of formerly blacklisted citizens suddenly regaining full BCI privileges and access to services, sparking confusion among Directorate enforcers and local organizers.
Restored citizens rally neighbors and form new committees. Rumors spread about an amnesty protocol and Halden’s intentions, triggering fresh neighborhood protests and Directorate crackdowns.

As unrest intensifies, Oksana Lintz and Rada Miskovic convene urgent negotiations with grassroots leaders and faction envoys, seeking a temporary pause in Directorate restrictions to prevent violence.
Facing mounting pressure and civic unrest, the Directorate concedes limited power to independent citizen committees in disrupted districts. Debate over Halden’s true motives dominates city discourse.
